sessions.title: The Scene Report
sessions.details: A staple of the event, The Scene Report is a panel that consistently blends new voices with well-established events, celebrating both the evolution and the roots of the artistic, experimental, and indie video game scene. This session highlights emerging initiatives and enduring communities, offering a comprehensive look at the forces shaping the future of artgames.This time we'll be hearing from Different Perspectives (Belgium) Playtopia (Capetown), OneTwoSix (Los Angeles) xxxx(Sweden), Accion Devs (Argentina) & Indie Dev Day (Spain)

sessions.title: Supporting local game scenes as community organizers
sessions.details: As organizers, we seek to cultivate and support our local game scenes. This conversation will give participants an opportunity to enumerate the needs of their local game scenes, the challenges they face, and the resources they thrive on. What strategies might help us connect these resources to our game scenes? We seek to provide a venue for potential and current organizers to share their experience and actionable steps that have worked for them.

sessions.title: Alternative ways of fostering the artgames scene
sessions.details: A panel discussion about creating unique editorial projects that elevate the visibility of independent and artistic game productions and explore their crossover with other media. Weâ€™ll be hearing from Mer Grazzini, from PressOver a website, podcast series and exhibit focused on Argentine and Latin American indie games, and from Angelo Careri, editor of the french magazine Immersion that blends film and video games

sessions.title: Artgames Showcase
sessions.details: A series of micro-presentations where six artists and developers from different countries will share the exploratory projects they are currently working on. This session offers a global perspective on how video games intersect with other fields and the diverse ways artists are pushing the boundaries and reimagining the medium.

sessions.title: The Palestinian Voices in Games Network
sessions.details: This session will present a new initiative, that began in response to the current war in Palestine, to support Palestinian creators in making games that could not be made otherwise. Several of the network's organizers will gather to present its current state, goals, needs, and what it offers, and invite listeners to join, take action, and grow the network's reach
